dict.'Auto zoom & pan the map to fit search r: 'Auto zoom & pan the map to fit search results, including Follow Active Note.'
dict.'The service used for searching for geol: 'The service used for searching for geolocations. To use Google, see details in the plugin documentation.'
dict.'If using Google as the geocoding search: 'If using Google as the geocoding search provider, paste the API key here. See the plugin documentation for more details. Changes are applied after restart.'
dict.'Use Google Places API instead of Google: 'Use Google Places API instead of Google Geocoding to get higher-quality results. Your API key must have a specific Google Places permission turned on! See the plugin documentation for more details.'
dict.'Date/times in the format can be wrapped: 'Date/times in the format can be wrapped in {{date:...}}, e.g. "note-{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}". Search queries can be added with {{query}}.'
dict.'Disk path for notes created from the ma: 'Disk path for notes created from the map.'
dict.'Choose the file to use as a template, e: 'Choose the file to use as a template, e.g. "templates/map-log.md".'
dict.'Maximal radius in pixels to cover in a: 'Maximal radius in pixels to cover in a marker cluster. Lower values will produce smaller map clusters. (Requires restart.)'
dict.'When jumping to the map from a note, wh: 'When jumping to the map from a note, what should be the display zoom? This is also used as a max zoom for "Map follows search results" above.'
dict.'Allow zooming further than the maximum: 'Allow zooming further than the maximum defined for the map source, interpolating the image of the highest available zoom.'
dict.'While making changes to the map, save t: 'While making changes to the map, save the history to be browsable through Obsidian back/forward buttons.'
dict.'What query to use for following active: 'What query to use for following active notes (in the main or mini view), $PATH$ being the file path.'
dict.'Monitor the clipboard and add a \"locat: 'Monitor the clipboard and add a "locations:" front-matter if a supported geolocation is pasted from the keyboard.'
dict.'The key Map View uses to denote a front: 'The key Map View uses to denote a front matter geolocation. Restart required. Beware: changing this will make your old front matter key not recognized as geolocations by Map View.'
dict.'Instead or in addition to the \"locatio: 'Instead or in addition to the "locations:" YAML tag, you can use a regular tag that will mark for Map View that a note has inline geolocations, e.g. "#hasLocations". (Note: this has a performance penalty for the time being.)'
dict.'URL to use for calculating and showing: 'URL to use for calculating and showing routes and directions, used for "route to point". {x0},{y0} are the source lat,lng and {x1},{y1} are the destination lat,lng.'
dict.'How and if Map View handles geolinks in: 'How and if Map View handles geolinks in notes (both front matter and inline)'
dict.'When turned on, Map View will handle ge: 'When turned on, Map View will handle geolinks internally, and turn front matter locations into links. (Requires restarting Obsidian to update correctly.)'
dict.'Show a popup with a map preview when ho: 'Show a popup with a map preview when hovering on geolinks in notes. Requires "Geolinks in Notes" above.'
dict.'Zoom level to use for the geolink map p: 'Zoom level to use for the geolink map preview popup.'
dict.'What is shown when hovering (desktop) o: 'What is shown when hovering (desktop) or clicking (mobile) map markers.'
dict.'Show a popup with the note name when ho: 'Show a popup with the note name when hovering on a map marker.'
dict.'In the popup above, show also the link: 'In the popup above, show also the link name, in the case of an inline link.'
dict.'In addition to the note name, show a pr: 'In addition to the note name, show a preview if the note contents. Either way, it will be displayed only if the map is large enough to contain it.'
dict.'Show a hover popup summarizing the icon: 'Show a hover popup summarizing the icons inside a marker cluster.'
dict.'Control when and if Map View should use: 'Control when and if Map View should use panes vs tabs, new panes vs existing ones etc.'
dict.'How should the corresponding note be op: 'How should the corresponding note be opened following a click on a marker?'
'How should the corresponding note be opened following a Ctrl+click on a marker?'
'How should the corresponding note be opened following a middle-click on a marker?'
'How should Map View open by default (e.g. when clicking the ribbon icon, or from within a note).'
dict.'How should Map View open when Ctrl is p: 'How should Map View open when Ctrl is pressed.'
dict.'How should Map View open when using mid: 'How should Map View open when using middle-click.'
dict.'Which way should the pane be split when: 'Which way should the pane be split when opening in a new pane.'
dict.'Change and switch between sources for m: 'Change and switch between sources for map tiles. An optional dark mode URL can be defined for each source. If no such URL is defined and dark mode is used, the map colors are reverted. See the documentation for more details.'
dict.\"'Open in' actions showing in geolocati: "'Open in' actions showing in geolocation-relevant popup menus. URL should have {x} and {y} as parameters to transfer."
dict.'Customizable rules for converting URLs: 'Customizable rules for converting URLs of various mapping services to coordinates, for the purpose of the "Convert URL" action.'
dict.'Use this for advanced settings not cont: 'Use this for advanced settings not controllable by the GUI above. Beware - uncareful edits can get Map View to faulty behaviors!'
dict.`Show available keyboard shortcuts at th: `Show available keyboard shortcuts at the bottom of the workspace quick switcher`
dict.`Show a confirmation prompt on workspace: `Show a confirmation prompt on workspace deletion`
dict.`Let the OS determine the light/dark mod: `Let the OS determine the light/dark mode setting when switching modes. This setting can only be used if Workspace Modes is enabled.`
dict..setName('Show inline link name on marke: .setName('Show inline link name on marker hover'
dict..setName('Show note preview on map marke: .setName('Show note preview on map marker hover'
dict.Refer to <a href=\"https://fontawesome.c: Refer to Font Awesome for icon names or use emojis, and see here for the other properties.
dict.<br>The rules override each other, start: The rules override each other, starting from the default. Refer to the plugin documentation for more details.
dict.<strong>Warning!</strong> This is an exp:
Warning! This is an experimental feature -- your milage may vary.
Make sure to read the documentation before using.'
text: 'Settings for the map view plugin.'
dict..addOption('dedicatedPane', 'Open in a 2: .addOption('dedicatedPane', 'Open in a 2nd pane and keep reusing it')
dict..addOption('dedicatedTab', 'Open in a ne: .addOption('dedicatedTab', 'Open in a new tab and keep reusing it')
dict..setTooltip('Save the current view as a: .setTooltip('Save the current view as a preset.')
dict..setTooltip('Save the current view as th: .setTooltip('Save the current view as the default one.')
dict..setTooltip('Copy the current view as a: .setTooltip('Copy the current view as a URL.')
.setTooltip('Copy the current view as a block code you can paste in notes for an inline map.')
dict..setTooltip('Open a full Map View with t: .setTooltip('Open a full Map View with the current state.')
dict..setTooltip('Update the source code bloc: .setTooltip('Update the source code block with the updated view state')
dict..setTooltip('Reset the view to the defin: .setTooltip('Reset the view to the defined default.')
dict..setTooltip('Update the view and its sou: .setTooltip('Update the view and its source code block from an open Map View')
dict..setTooltip('Set the map view to fit all: .setTooltip('Set the map view to fit all currently-displayed markers.')
